Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel in Central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: FABREE
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel at least three times over the last 2 years and I'm certainly pleased with the standard of rooms and service provided. It's within walking distance to plaza catalunya the epicentre of Barcelona and la ramblas. Rooms are well appointed, confotablr bed with fine egyptian cotton and trendy bath rooms. I usually go for the higher rooms with balcony ovelooking the main street with nice view without being too noisy . They provide excellent toiletries used to be from the White company but the latest range is equally good. The staffs ate friendly and since being under H10 wing the service is better. You can get a double room for less than £100 if u book early . The only drawback is that the wifi is not free . Otherwise an excellent stay in a boutique hotel in central location.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Ron G
Reviews.Content: After our agent booked us into this hotel we read a poor review and wondered. Don't believe all you read. This modern hotel has a wonderfully convenient location to explore Barcelona, the whole hotel is immaculate and the staff are helpful in the extreme. We will be recommending it to all our friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for everything”
Reviews.Author: kem777
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days in Barcelona, and had a ball. The hotel is very central without being on the main streets. We walked to the square for the tourist buses in 10-15 mins. Lots of cafes and restaurants in the area. The hotel was clean and did a breakfast to cover all nations and set you up for the day. Nice bar in the lobby for a drink when you get back from a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price / quality ratio, but avoid lower floors”
Reviews.Author: marcoferra
Reviews.Content: 15 mins walking to plaza catalunya this renewed hotel is one of the best quality for the right price solution. Rooms are clean and modern, bathrooms are clean and quite spacious. To improve: breakfast. For 15 euros is not soooo fantastic. I personally suggest to cross the road, go to a bar for breakfast and save some money. Avoid lower floors, as the rooms faces gran via and it's a caothic street. Metro is at 150mts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spacious...but horrible showers!”
Reviews.Author: strizzle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in March. Great location to visit the tourist sites...kinda noisy with the road...a few loud ambulances, but not that bad. The rooms are big and have nice beds for European standards. One thing that needs to be fixed is their showers! They are typical european half enclosed with a wall and half open to the rest of the bathroom. The spicket that shoots out water does not point down. As a result, you have to hold the shower sprayer at all times. You get water all over the bathroom...we put down 2 towels and that seemed to help. The only other complaint is kind of petty, but the scrambled eggs at the breakfast are bad...they are fake eggs and taste strange. Also, they don't have American coffee. The coffee they have tastes like espresso on steroids! We couldn't bear to drink it. If they fixed, the showers, we would stay here again...if you can get this for 90 euros/110 USD then it's worth it with the bad showers considering the location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Robbed in the hotel lobby”
Reviews.Author: lizlemon86
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were so looking forward to our stay in Barcelona last July. When we arrived to check in at this property, we were told our room was not ready and could we please wait in the lobby. In retrospect, this was a bit of a red flag. We sat down in the very beautiful lobby and waited. Having been so vigilant about security, I disappointingly let my guard down here and didn't hold on to one of my bags (putting it on the floor in front of me). A few minutes later, there was an insistent tapping on the glass behind us. After multiple annoying taps, I turned around to see a man on the street waving a key chain at me, asking if I had dropped it. I shook my head no, and when I turned back around, my bag was gone. I immediately asked some other guests if they had seen anything, and they confirmed they had seen a few men loitering inside. I ran to reception and was greeted with a very uninterested staffer who told me that I should "be careful in Barcelona, especially downtown" because there are thieves. Great advice EXCEPT I HAD JUST BEEN ROBBED IN THE LOBBY OF THIS VERY HOTEL. He gave me a map to the police station and told me there was nothing they could do. When we returned from filing our police report, another manager came up and apologised. She said they had reviewed security footage and we had indeed been robbed by a team of about four men, three of whom had been casing the lobby. They let us have free access to the wireless internet, but that was the only concession made to us by the hotel. We only stayed one night and left early the next day to get a new passport in a different city. I sure hope the thieves enjoy my seven year old iPod, diary and sweater, because that's basically all they got. Lax security aside, the hotel is indeed very well appointed and the rooms are lovely. I understand we were unlucky and the theft wasn't necessarily the hotel's fault, however I would advise against staying there due to the behaviour of the staff after we were robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - Close to the City Centre”
Reviews.Author: SV-1979
Reviews.Content: H10 Casanova is located just 10min. walking distance from Plaza Catalunya. The reception and lounge area are decorated in a minimal style whilst the rooms are very spacious with new furniture and fittings and laminated wooden-floor. The staff is very friendly and helpful and is ready to assist you in everything you need for making you stay in Barcelona as pleasant as possible. The hotel has also a small Spa. I would definitely recommend this hotel as "value for money" accomodation!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: britishpike
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of March 2012. The location was brilliant, only a 10 minute walk (maximum) to the Rambla's. The hotel was modern, clean and good service from all staff. The only let down was the cooked breakfast, cold and greasy but the continental breakfast was good enough, loads of cheese, cold meats and bread. Free wifi for all guests and internet access in the lobby. We got the A2 bus from the airport and it stops a couple of minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ARCHIE0410
Reviews.Content: A contempory hotel in a great location. The lobby and bar are relatively basic but are fine. The bedrooms are really nice and quite funky. The bath and shower is a one wet room. The beds are comfy and hallelujah for free WIFI. The hotel has a small spa but there are no other facilities. Breakfast is simple but fine. All in all, a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business (and not only) Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rexeric
Reviews.Content: I slept at the Casanova for 3 nights during a trade show in February. The personnell was very friendly, the room clean and spacious and although mine was at 2nd floor facing the trafficked Gran Via, the four-glass windows completely insulated from any noise. I hardly knew there were cars passing by. The Metro station is just nearby but the Hotel is just at walking distance from Plaza Catalunia and it is surrounded by many nice tapas bar. The Hotel bar was open late and the bar tender was friendly and always smiling. I enjoyed staying here and I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as good as in the past.”
Reviews.Author: AshleyQuint
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Casanova before when it was part of the Rafael Hoteles group, and with the H10 takeover I thought it would be interesting to see the changes. One thing I do like is wifi is now free, which you used to have to pay for. However ... There are no comfortable chairs in the room anymore, only a small desk chair. The heating also seemed to be stuck on - really, really hot! Not sure if I would stay again - the Villa Emelia looks a better proposition.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: catsabroad
Reviews.Content: Good location close to metro and short walk to Pl. Catalunya / La Rambla. Have stayed in other H10 hotels previously and this one is a notch above in terms of style and comfort, Rooms are a good size with comfortable beds and a great shower. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: niki n
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to find, especially when we took the airport shuttle bus into the city. The lobby is abit dark at night. Concierge staff very welcoming but no wi-fi in room, unfortunately. The hotel is close to some attractions. Hotel was clean, and modern. Not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, centric, nice.”
Reviews.Author: barcelonabp
Reviews.Content: You know... Hotels rates goes up and down very fast. Today rate for one weekend night was 65€. Is a good hotel for this rate. Location is centric, but 14 minutes walking to Paseo de Gracia. Hotel is nice, nice design, look like new. Room is small, bed is small too.... Double bed around 140 cm.... Many amenities, good heating, good bathtub. Staff is not very good, but I just want to sleep. Is enouht to give a room and pay for the room. Few restaurants in this area if you want to go to diner out, but is ok at 10 minutes walking in a big avenue. Safe area.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jiffo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Christmas and found it a good choice. The location is near to the centre but sufficiently away from the tourist places with some good basic cafes and restaraunts in the area. The staff were very friendly and helpful - and in all it was a pleasant stay with good clean room and nice facilities, breakfast and cheapish mini bar!!! It wouldn't be suitable for families with children though. The only complaint was that the aircon didn't work properly - though for us and at this time of year it wasn't a problem. Traffic noise could put some people off this hotel - it is on a busy road and without aircon in the summer this would be unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “business hotel close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: Purav00
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. good for passengers with a low budget and who just want a place to crash. Located about 10-15 minutes walk from the city center (La Rambla). Staff is very helpful and tries to make you most comfortable. Bus station and train station also at a short walk. We even forgot our money pouch in the safe and they had it kept at the reception for many days till someone picked it up. Its rated 4 star but more like a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: The_Gilberts_SAUK
Reviews.Content: The bed was very comfy and the room very clean, albeit a bit small. It was a bit basic for a 4 star though, and seemed to rely on 'designer' fittings to create its modern image at the expense of more practical items such as storage space. Fittings were looking a little tired as well. The bathroom was prefectly adequate, but the shower got a bit messy. No kettle or coffee cups in the room, just a minibar. The breakfast was good, a pretty standard selection of both english and continental items, with very good coffee. Breakfast room was a bit cramped though. However, the hotel is well located and within easy walking distance of Catalunya Square and the Ramblas. I would stay there again as the hotel was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expect”
Reviews.Author: Oran1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be 3 stars top, the room is pretty small European style, the closet does not have room for cloth for 2 people for 5 days only 1. the shower is a mess first the bath itself is half closed so water spill all over the floor making it a mess it may sounds petty but it is really annoying, also they did not give us shampoo at all and did not refilled our soap, we got some from home but thous should be refilled anyway, when we asked for a refill they gave us, stuff was nice not always helpful. the breakfast was pretty lame only the cheese was good all the other was eatable but no more then that. the location is OK but not great its 10 minutes walk from Plasa Catalunia which is ok but there are closer hotels and in the end of the evening if you are going out after midnight you need to walk a little bit back.

Reviews.Title: “Bright & modern in good location”
Reviews.Author: DavidKSurrey
Reviews.Content: Nice bright, modern hotel in a good location. 5 minutes walk from Placa Universitat metro, local bus and Aerobus stops. 10 minutes walk from Placa Cataluyna and La Rambla. Nice, small, modern hotel with bright, calm reception area. Nice rooms, but a bit let down by slightly shabby fittings, especially in the batroom and less than great cleaning. Road outside is one of the main througfareas and is very busy and therefore noisy. Room has double glazing and air conditioning. There appear to be rooms at the back of the hotel which may be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinefamily100
Reviews.Content: A very stylish hotel, our room was perfectly adequate with plenty of wardobe and drawer space, bathroom clean with nice selection of toiletries, the only problem for us was the door handle broken which meant we could not open the window but not really a problem as had air con and as located on a busy road the noise meant we didn't really want to open it, also the lighting a bit low in bedroom and a bit harsh in the bathroom! The breakfast had a good choice of hot and cold options it was busy at 9 o'clock but the food was replenished regularly. A good location, just a 10 min walk to the Las Ramblas and to the square where the sightseeing buses depart from. The airport bus took just half an hour with pick up just a few streets away. This was our first visit to Barcelona and when we return I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, over designed rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pookie79
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - great location but not classic 4 star - no porter service. The room was very clean and comfortable - however we stayed here for a full week - and struggled with NO STORAGE SPACE at all - not a single drawer or surface! A bit over-designed and not really practical - however very comfortable, great location, friendly staff and good food - I would go return and recommend but it isn't easy to keep your belongings tidy or relax in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sue B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights booked on wotif. great price. close to trains and 10 minutes walk to La Rumbla. Huge bathroom. shared with teenager. plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Modern”
Reviews.Author: ybanke
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just stayed at this property during our first trip to Barcelona. We found the hotel to be very pleasant and in a great location. The room was clean and decorated in modern decor and the bathroom was roomy, much larger than what i would expect to find in Europe. the hotel is located on the main strip of the Gran Via and it was few blocks away from the metro located near the University. I liked this location because we could easily commute to the really busy areas such as Las Ramblas but still enjoy some piece and quiet when returned at night to sleep. The staff was friendly was helpful in giving suggestions for nearby attractions. There are cafes located within a block of the hotel so there is no problem finding food. Since Gran Via gets a good amount of traffice hailing taxis was convienent too. The hotel had other ammenties such as a nice lobby bar and a spa but I did not use those but the bar looked very inviting. The only drawback on this hotel was that is does not have a pool and the walls are a little thin in the rooms but not enough where I was not able to sleep. All in all I would stay here again or any H10 property for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Kaysie81
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel. Location is ideal for exploring Las Ramblas and the coastal areas. The rooms were spacious, clean and the shower is fantastic! The reception staff were friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “good but not quite 4 star”
Reviews.Author: julifer
Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel in a good location, near La Rambla but far enough away not to be kept up by the revellers. it is on a really busy main road, so there is quite a lot of street noise from the rooms at the front, but we didn't mind this. Our bed was really comfy and the room was clean and nicely decorated. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good. The only downsides were the bathroom, which although it had a double shower, didn't have a proper door so water got everywhere, and there was some mould in the shower and it was generally on the scruffy side. The other downside was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room - not a huge deal but it is nice to be able to make a cuppa after a long day of sightseeing! All in all, it is a nice hotel in a good location but our room didn't live up to a 4 star standard, although we may have been unlucky as the rest of the hotel was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “ideal tourist base away from crowds”
Reviews.Author: SSpade
Reviews.Content: Exactly as Trip Advisor info thank you. 2 blocks from airport bus and metro. Modern, clean (except for for footprint in bath day 2). Compact rooms, twin beds right next to each other. Good sized bath with shower, large towels. Powerful hairdryer. Excellent breakfast with hot bacon and scrambled eggs. Helpful desk staff. Max 10 mins walk to La Rambla, ideal for us as we wanted to avoid. Had a room overlooking busy crossroads which we didnt mind as we could look out from balcony and enjoy the buzz. Quiet inside hotel. Excellent air con.Great looking bar but nobody was ever in it. Local cafes. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Kev5391
Reviews.Content: Spent five days and four nights here. Got the Aerobus from the airpot (only 5.30 euros) and it sopped a two minute walk from the hotel so don't bother with a taxi. Location was very good, about 7 to 10 minutes walk to La Ramblas and 2 or 3 minutes walk to a choice of 2 metro staions. We had a room on the 4th floor and the only complaint was that the traffic was a bit noisy at night. Can't really complain as we were in the centre of a city. We chose this hotel as it was close to the centre but not too close to La Ramblas, which is very noisy. The hotel is clean and modern. There were three of us sleeping in one room but still had plenty of space. The breakfast was included in the package and was really first class. There was even scrambled eggs and bacon which you do not usually get on the Continent. The rooms are air conditioned and to a very good standard. If I had to find fault I would say that some of the fixtures were looking a bit tired. We were told that there would be a welcome pack in the room. We assumed these were the the crisps and peanuts left on the side. When it came time to check out we were charged 10 euros. Be warned. The staff were friendly and helpful. If I came to Barcelona again I would deinately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Was just OK - would go elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: zeckster
Reviews.Content: The place was clean and comfortable but the location was just a few blocks from the area of town that tourists were told to avoid. We had no problems but saw others at the front desk that had been pick pocketed. We had two rooms both which had AC problems on the first 2 of 4 nights. The staff could not or would not move us to rooms where the AC was working. On the plus side the internet was great and it was very close to the gay section of town.

Reviews.Title: “Its ok”
Reviews.Author: Komvok
Reviews.Content: A good 4 star hotel but.... Internet is extra in the year 2011 and each time when u go to room , i reccomend you to go reveption to check ur door card to ask if it is working or not. Otherwise, you can return back to reception as it never works!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: monguito
Reviews.Content: We had a really great time. Great friendly services. We really enjoy it

Reviews.Title: “Modern & minimal”
Reviews.Author: AoLiN
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel with helpful staff, modern furnishings and comfortable rooms. Location fifteen minutes by foot to centre. Not cheap, not expensive. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it def will be back to stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: bisla1
Reviews.Content: A brillant stay staff were helpfull, the hotel was very very clean. it was near all the attractions def the la rables only 7 - 10min walk. Room was very roomy only downfall the wifi is expensive...........It should be free as lots of other hotels offer free wifi!!!! We also caught the bus from the airport to the the hotel and back again......alot cheaper than the taxis and it was very easy to find!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in good location for the money”
Reviews.Author: golfingmd
Reviews.Content: I had a junior suite which had a small living room with a flat screen TV and bathroom as well as separate bedroom with bathroom with separate tub and shower. The hotel is very clean and in a good location. I read other reviews complaining that the walk is too far to La Rambla. It is only 5-7 min walk and unless you have some handicap it is no big deal. The front desk staff all spoke very good English and were very helpful in providing directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. They also did a good job of responding to emails arranging airport pick up. All in all I would stay here again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: CatCatx
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again, the service was efficient and friendly, with perfect English spoken by all reception staff, which made us feel very ashamed! We took the bus to and from the airport, which was very easy with bus stops very close to the hotel. The location was good, an easy walk into the centre of the city, near two metro stops during the day and near night bus stops if you are out late. We stayed in a courtyard room, which was very quiet at night - not disturbed by noise at all. We were offered a balcony room when checking in and the receptionist seemed very surprised that we wanted to stick with the courtyard! However, the front-facing balcony rooms are on the main road so although you get the view we thought it would be too noisy at night for us. We didn't have a problem with the shower as some others have mentioned - we had an enclosed glass shower rather than a wet room, which was great, although it didn't have a shelf on which to place toiletries, which was a bit strange. The bathroom was huge and had a proper hairdryer rather than the usual ineffectual hotel ones! Very clean, safe, nicely designed public areas. Be aware that the main doors are locked at night (not sure what time) so you have to ring the bell to get in but the security guy does sit right by the door so will open them quickly for you! I would say that this is an absolutely great hotel if you want efficency, trendy rooms/communal areas with good design features in addition to the four-star amenities you would expect. We got a great deal with Lastminute.com and I think it was worth the price. If you are looking for a quirky, more traditionally Spanish-style place, then this isn't for you!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay in july”
Reviews.Author: Mitch1022
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very easy access to the metro stations, only a couple of stops on the metro to Las ramblas, sagrada and all major sights. Very clean rooms, good breakfast buffet. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay but no free wifi”
Reviews.Author: faculty1919
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for an entire week. The location is fantastic! Very close to the Metro. Very close to many restaurants, and a 10 minute walk to Ramblas. Couldn't have picked a better area. The staff was very nice and very patient with me. I was alone and had never been to Barcelona. Pablo at the front desk especially was very patient and very informative to me. I was VERY disappointed that they charge for wifi in the hotel. I think that's absolutely ridiculous in this day and age. You can plug your computer up to the wall for internet for free, but no free wifi. And they charge a lot for wifi. The room service food was surprisingly great. The sandwiches were so good. My actual room was spacious with a fantastic view. FANTASTIC VIEW. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: maude_leroux
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in a package with the airplane ticket. We really enjoyed our stay. First of all, location, location, location. The shuttle from the airport leaves you a block away from the hotel. It is situated near the university, in a good, safe neibourghood with a lot of restaurants. Walking distance from La Rambla (10 minutes) and the old city. We didn't take the subway a lot but the station is a 5 minutes walk. After reading the reviews about the noise, we asked for a room on the courtyard but none was available. They offered a suite but at 70 E plus taxes, we decided to keep our room on the first floor. We were really glad, the room was beautiful, just like in the pictures on the website. There was a balcony that we enjoyed after our days of walking and sightseeing. The windows are really good, no problem sleeping. The room was clean. As it is written in the reviews, the bathroom gets all wet when you take a shower but it is not the first time that I see this in Europe! The breakfast was included. it is buffet style, there is plenty and it is really good. There is a wired internet but the wi-fi is really expensive (we were not able to use the wire, having only our i-phone). There is a Barcelona Wi-Fi network free in a lot of public spaces. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially because of the location and because of the quality of the service. We would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CC6169
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location between the Universitat and Urquell Metro stops right on Gran Via. The area is quiet yet in walking distance to Placa Catalunya and La Rambla. We emailed the front desk a few days before we arrived asking for a high floor room facing a street with a balcony and that is what we got. Staff is nice and very helpful - English well spoken. The rooms are very modern yet comfortable. The only complaint was the shower which had only a partial glass enclosure so water ended up everywhere every time we took a shower (including soaking both rolls of toilet paper). Form over function I suppose. There is a restaurant in the lobby but we never saw anyone there during our 2 night stay. I'm sure the food is fine but there are so many other amazing places to go in Barcelona I would recommend heading out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family of 5”
Reviews.Author: jayregis
Reviews.Content: Pre-cruise 3 night stay with wife and 3 kids. It wasn't fun finding a hotel that could accommodate us, but the Casanova had connecting rooms, perfect for a family of 5. Super nice and modern lobby. Rooms very nicely decorated and comfortable. Great location; could easily walk to La Rambla and “Placa de Catalunya” to catch double-decker tour buses. Would have liked free wifi and more English language TV channels. Warning to other families of 5: There are very few taxis that can accommodate 5 in Barcelona. The staff of the Casanova put is in contact with one of the few and we used his services. Otherwise, we would have had to take 2 cabs everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Stay. Wonderful Staff! Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tcakaren
Reviews.Content: As I start all my searches, I look for the location I want and get as close to it without spending a fortune. I picked this hotel for that reason. Great, quite location within walking of the Ramblas and the Plaza Catalunya on the Gran Via. Fantastic 4-star hotel for the price. Breakfast buffet was great, rooms very nice. The front desk staff was FANTASTIC! The tapas served in the bar seem to be a hit with locals.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location to access the sites in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Beachbulldoglover
Reviews.Content: Cool modern decor. Great location on Gran Via so easy to get to both modern and older parts of the city. Very walkable site seeing. Do try Segons Mercat, a great little seafood place just a block away. Hotel staff are friendly and rooms are comfy -- we've slept very well. Bed is really comfortable -- no back aches here!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMHDumbo
Reviews.Content: I agree with the general sentiment expressed by most reviewers – it’s a good hotel, but there are a number of little details that could make it even better. Overall, though, it’s quite funky, quite modern, clean, good breakfast buffet and it’s in a good central, location, particularly if you want to explore Gaudi (Casa Battlo and Sagrada Familia are at easy walking distance). The service was superb! Friendly, helpful, competent. It’s gay friendly, everyone friendly, really. My one major issue was that a lot of the room face the Gran Via Cortes Catalanes, which is busy and noisy. I had asked for a quiet room, but the hotel was full so they just couldn’t accommodate my request. I sleep lightly so that made sleeping nigh impossible for me the first night. We moved to another room facing the courtyard for the remaining nights and slept beautifully. I think other reviewers have mentioned the little strange details (like you can’t stop the water from running out onto the floor from the shower), but my partner (who has travelled throughout Spain more than I have) suggested that the building itself and level of comfort is of a high standard for Spain. For the practical bits: Casanova is right between the metro stops Universitat and Urgell, a 5-minute walk from either of them and a 10-minute walk from Plaza Catalunya. The airport bus stops at Universitat coming from the airport, so it’s very easy to find! There are a few good restaurants up in Eixample, a short walk from Casanova, but we found they were generally quite pricey. There’s a pharmacy on the opposite side of the road, a little grocery shop nearby and bus no 50 (which takes you to the Joan Miro Foundation) goes right outside. If you aren’t bothered by traffic noise or can guarantee a room facing the courtyard, I would recommend this hotel. Best: the fantastic service. Worst: the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, close to center of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Marcel411969
Reviews.Content: Visit several hotels in Barcelona, but Casanova Hotel are really perfect to combine business and relax. Near the Ramblas, 5 minutes walk and perfect connections with Metro and Aerobus.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT book at this hotel if you have a family with young children”
Reviews.Author: Encoreocala
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline.com and got Rafaelhoteles by Casanova. On Priceline.com there is not a place to add children. We called the hotel directly to tell them that we needed two extra beds,The first thing was that there was a charge of over 50 Euro per night per child. Then they said that there was only enough room for three persons in a room. That meant that we, as grandparents, would have one child in our room. When we called back to accept these "terms", the person taking reservations said they do NOT have TWO beds. I asked that she double-check on this as it is part of a hotel chain. She said that it is Easter and they are fully booked. I said that we needed two beds, one in each room and she could not get an additional bed. She told me to cancel the reservation and so we called Princeline and they refunded our booking. We then were able to book at Fira Palace where they welcomed familes with children and we had a great week at that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and location. value for money.”
Reviews.Author: bw1961
Reviews.Content: read the reviews before booking and we were not disappointed. Very friendly and helpful staff. Good location about 10 mins walk from La Ramblas. Nice clean contempary hotel, well maintained. If you don't want road noise try and get a room facing the courtyard. Room 603 was very near the room that the cleaners were in and out of in the morning to get their cleaning supplies, so if you want to avoid the noise then make sure you donn't have that room. Make sure you take a Lonely Planet Guide with you, as the spanish guides aren't as comprehensive and easy to use. All in all a great hotel, value for money and Barcelona is a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Daryl64
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well positioned and pretty central. The rooms were excellent with some nice little touches. The buffet breakfast was great with plenty of choice and the staff were very attentive. I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “amazing, classy designer hotel - we loved it”
Reviews.Author: hoangando
Reviews.Content: We’ve stayed at Rafael Hotel by Casanova for 6 nights in April 2011 and have brimmed over with enthusiasm for the modern and classy design. Location: The hotel is located right between the metro stations Urgell and Universitat (few minutes walk). Because of our central position, we walked most of the time from the hotel to… … Plaza Espanya – about 10 min. (TMB- Bus and Aerobus to airport stops there) … Plaza Catalunya – about 10 min. (Aerobus to airport) … La Rambla – about 15 min. … Mercat de Boqueria – about 20 min. … Montjuic – 15 min. Room: We had a Standard Room on the 7th floor with an outlook to the courtyard (Spa’s stone garden). The room is furnished very modernly in various shades of brown and green. The room is beautifully light-flooded thanks to a huge window. The bathroom is arranged in black with a dark stone floor, the shower area is tiled brightly and it is decorated with really huge mirrors (really awesome!). We had twin beds, TV, minibar, safe and internet (lan). Breakfast: Buffet was open from 7.30 to 10.30 (on weekends to 11.30) with warm – like bacon and scrambled eggs - and cold meals. There have been fruits, yogurts, pastries and Spanish specialities like Serrano ham, Chorizos Extras and various tortillas. The staff was courteous und very cordial, like the rest of the hotel, the breakfast saloon was really modernly designed (with a glass front and view to the lobby). Misc: There are 8th floors and 2 elevators, restaurant’s on the 1st floor, spa’s on the 2nd floor with a pretty stone garden and in the evening, there’s a DJ in the bar. Conclusion: We really liked the hotel, it was worth each cent we paid. Awesome rooms, service and central location… Next time we visit Barcelona, we will check in at Casanova’s again

Reviews.Title: “love the hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruisecrazyBoston
Reviews.Content: thank you so much for everything i loved the rooms and the location but the most stunning is the decor of the rooms best in barcellona i had a blast !!! was so good and of course ill be back in august and of course i will re book at casanova hotel, again thank you to the staff for an amazing stay and thank you for the great service its very rare in barcellona for sure my best ever experience

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: vered90
Reviews.Content: his morning my husband and I returned from vacation in Barcelona, we were at the cacanova hotel. I have no words to describe how good the hotel, the service, the food, the rooms, the location... This is obviously one of the best hotels we've been! Highly recommended !! I have no doubt that whoever comes to holiday in the hotel - will benefit greatly! Thanks to the team hotel, Oz Family Israel

Reviews.Title: “CATALAN HOSPITALITY!!”
Reviews.Author: ViNik
Reviews.Content: Great choise for your first time in Barcelona! A very nice cozy hotel with easy access to metro, lovely rooms and amazing staff !!! The people there made our experience even better.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel overall, lighting was a challenge”
Reviews.Author: wilkinsm99
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a very good hotel. We upgraded to a superior room; very large with large bathroom. Clean and comfortable. However, the light in the room was lousy; same in bathroom. I think an effort to make it chic, they went a little crazy with the lighting and it is not great for reading at night or putting on makeup. That notwithstanding, everything elese was fine. The staff was especially friendly and helpful, Rut and Edgar in particular were a big help to us on multiple occasions. I would stay here again and recommend it for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great idea for a hotel, not so great execution”
Reviews.Author: Kas_f74
Reviews.Content: A difficult review to write as the person who designed this hotel deserves credit. Its like they came up with the perfect hotel, with all the amenities a person could ever want, ran out of money, cut corners, and hired inexperienced staff. The rooms are roomy and comfy, however...... most things dont work. Take a wet suit with you with some snorkels and flippers as the bath room leaks water like a broken dam!!! The taps leak, the basin leaks, the shower leaks... im not about a trickle, i mean a full blown leak... The rooms are also equipped with internet.... if you can find a port that works. Lucky for us, we had a larger room (adjoining room) so i could plug the cable into the port in the second room, but that was a mission in itself trying to get access to the port. Service is what lets this hotel down more than anything else... like i said we had an adjoining room with a fold out bed in the second room... they gave us a pillow, but no blanket. We gave up asking for a blanket on the 3rd occasion and just covered our little boy with a bath robe. I cant say, unfortunately, that the staff were hospitable. location is very good, away from the hustle and bustle but not too far that you cant walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Logun
Reviews.Content: Apart from a dark entrance this is a GREAT hotel. Good breakfast, great ambiance, cool bar, clean and tidy room, super location. Well worth a stay!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL !!!”
Reviews.Author: martinlp1
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a fantastic weekend in barcelana ! Booked this with my Thomson agent as he'd recommended it - it's through Sovereign - one of their companies.. We got free Mercedes transfers and free airport lounge before we took off ! The hotel is in a great location right on the Gran Via - in the Example district. Las ramblas was a 10 minute walk away and there was a metro stop nearby (universtat). The rooms were very modern andf felt warm and calm in a kind of way. Very comfy beds and an amazing bathroom - with a wet room and a "rain" shower - great water pressure too !! Breakfats was good - fresh fruit, cold and hot buffet - great coffee ! The bar was fantastic - they even have their own DJ on fridays and saturdays ! They project images and concerts on the walls too ! Cocktails were around €10 each - which was the same price as the bars and clubs we went to. All in all a greta hotel - ideal for those looking for trendy and chic !!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: maya_tair
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at the hotel. Not too big, nice modern rooms, very quiet (we were at the back side), excellent location, good transport communications at the hotel's door, great breakfast, helpful front desk, in short - great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelBuff
Reviews.Content: Good value, trendy rooms. If you are a gay traveler, it's a great location. The axel is nicer with its roofdeck but it's a bit more expensive. Free wireline internet, but not wifi. Lighting is bright and shower door needed some more rubber caulking to prevent leakage. but I'd stay there again in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Definately worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: citybreaker91
Reviews.Content: We chose the Casanova for its central location, near enough to La Rambla to stroll of an evening but without the hustle and bustle of the hotels along that stretch. Also good access to Pg. de Gracia etc. and the sights north of Placa de Catalunya.It fitted the bill.Easy to get to ,we took the airport bus and arrived at 11am.Not surprisingly, our room was not ready but we were offered a twin that we could take then, instead of our booked double.We declined as we were able to leave our luggage at no cost and returned after an afternoon of sightseeing.We were surprised to find that the room was infact a twin but decided not to make an issue of it.The room was nicely presented and clean though in the bathroom there was a wet patch on the floor by the shower screen.We discovered that the screen was not water tight so each time we used the shower,a puddle would form. That aside, the shower itself was the best ,huge shower head and excellent pressure with plenty of room as it was done like a wet room alongside the bath. The hairdryer did not work and showed signs of being repaired in the past with cellotape! We reported this at reception on our way out that evening and were told that maintanance would see to it the following day. We slept well,beds comfortable,blackout curtains,and relatively quiet tho bit of a hum from traffic (room on second floor overlooking main street). Breakfast was everything you would expect and more- wide choice of cold meats, cheese,breads, pasties,fresh fruit,cereal and cooked- bacon,scrambled egg,tomatoes. tea, coffee and fresh juice.Staff attentive and polite. After a fantastic day , Park Guell ,La Pedrera,Casa Batllo etc we returned to find that the hairdryer was still broken.With only one day left,it didnt seem worth complaining again! Again, we left our luggage at reception whilst we enjoyed more sightseeing. Overall, a good hotel if you want to be central but just a little off the 'commercial' track! A couple of issues but in fairness we didnt make fuss. Good value for what we paid and definately would return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, welcoming - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Poffster
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, and loved it. There had been a mix up with our booking when we checked in (agent's fault, we think), but the staff at Reception sorted it with no fuss while we had a free drink and tapas in the bar. All the staff we dealt with were cheerful and helpful. (The hotel also stored our cases all day for us after we checked out.) The rooms are very clean and comfortable - the bathroom lighting was a bit inadequate for shaving/make-up application, but that was all we could fault. Breakfast was good - good variety of fruit, breads, salad, cheese and cold meats plus a hot buffet. We didn't try the restaurant in the evening. To get there, we recommend getting the Aeroport bus and getting off at Placa Universitat - the hotel is two blocks back along Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes on the opposite side of the road. Easy walking and felt very safe. (Constant traffic but noise not really intrusive) Really enjoyed our stay - look forward to the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice and trendy but bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: flossy1987
Reviews.Content: We were unable to check into our room until 4pm because the cleaners had not finished the rooms. We checked in at 2pm, only to be told that it would be half an hour wait, then another half an hour and so on until 4pm. The customer service of the reception staff was terrible during this time. Our room was lovely: very clean and had a little balcony. The only problem was that the walls were very thin so it often felt like someone was coming in the room when they were going into their own room opposite the corridor! The location was perfect-only 5mins walk to La Rambla. Breakfast was a great selection and great quality. The initial customer service let us down, but overall it was a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, overall service could be improved”
Reviews.Author: tg49ers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Casanova for 4 nights in mid August 2010 while celebrating our one year wedding anniversary. I struggled very hard in what I would rate as I really do think they tried hard to make our stay a good one. Let me first say that the location is ok, you are about 15 minutes to Plaza Catalunya and the edge of La Ramblas. I would not say that it is that much quieter than staying closer to the action though, if you want less noise, ask for an inside room, the outside rooms are facing the street and it is one of the busier streets. Getting to hotel isn't too bad, in general I really liked how easy it was to get from airport to central Barceona, just take the Aerobus on the ground level and it stops at the 4 major spots ending in Plaza Catalunya.and costs 5 EUR or so each way. This is a nice boutique hotel, nice clean rooms of average size. I never tried the breakfast so i cannot comment on that. We did have drinks and food in the restaurants a few nights as well. Their sign saying "free tapas with first drink" is abit misleading, they will give you their choice of a tapa but it is only one per group. So if you go their with a group and expect to get one per person and the one of your choice, you will be disappointed. The prices are abit high considering where they are as you can go across the street or even to La Ramblas and get the same for less, including tapa prices. Service - the are all very nice people that work at Casanova, especially the Assisant Manager, Sarah, she is probably the best asset the hotel has. As I have said nice things about the hotel, I will now outline the things they lacked service wise to justify the rating that I gave them: Day 1 - Our plane was delayed so we didn't arrive at the hotel until around 8:30pm. We found the hotel very easily and went to the front to check in. I had booked us for a non smoking double/queen room. When we went to our room, the first thing we noticed was it had been smoked in, all you non smokers would know what I mean, and if you have asthma, it is even worse! We went back to reception to ask for another room, the one guy working at reception then tried arguing with me that it was a non smoking room! Well, I asked him to come to the room with me and then he knew I was right. They did not have a room available with a double or queen, so they had to move us to a room with two twins and promised they would move us to a room with a bigger bed the next day. Day 2 - I woke up and went to reception asking to see when the new room was available. they informed me after people are completely checked out, so mid afternoon around 3pm. I told her that we would be touring the city and we agreed that we would pack up all our stuff and keep our belongings inside our room and move it when we got back. This was better for us as we had our passports and valuables in the safe. We toured around and came back around 7pm. I went to reception and once they got through all the confusion that we were allowed to move (you think they'd actually talk about it with the differents shifts), they gave us a room. My wife and I went to our old room to grab our stuff. When we went to our room all of our luggage was gone and they had checked in someone else into our room!! AND TO MAKE IT WORSE, they felt they had the liberty just to open up our safewith their master key and leave it for the new guests, so now, not only did they allow someone to check into our room, all of our confidential information and valuables were left open for the people the checked in, including alot of jewelery and money. NOT PROFESSIONAL AT ALL. Thankfully the people who checked in after us didn't take anything or maybe they hadn't seen the safe yet. We went back to reception in panic to find out where our belongings were and to ask them why they would just open up the safe and leave it wide open??? They could not explain and did not seem too concerned by it as we were quite concerned, especialy for our passports. They then realized they took the liberty to move our belongings to the new room with a double without letting us know, but did explain why they would just leave the safe open for people to go through our personal valuables. Thankfully after much grief we located our belongings in the new room and went through our valuables, and found our passports, etc. The only thing that was missing was my sunglasses and some food and snacks that i purchased. I had informed recpetion of this and they told me they would try to locate it. Day 3 - I went to reception to ask about my sunglasses and snacks. They informed us that the snacks were thrown out but they would just let us by the snacks and reimburse it for us, which was around 10 EUR. But my sunglasses were no where to be found. they checked with housekeeping and claimed to check the room again and said they could not find it. I wasn't happy about it and they said they would look again during the day. We got back in the evening and ask them about my sunglasses. After much confussion again, as they thought I had found them, they sent people to see if it was in the lost and found and checked the room again. They could not find it. and could do nothing to help me out. One of those "your words vs ours" - they could not prove I actually lost my glasses. This upset me a little as I know i was not trying to make a false claim. But I understoood where they were coming from. My only response if Casanova Management is reading this is: "NONE of us would be in this situation if they would have had better communication and not moved our belongings and opened up our safe for everyone to have access to in the first place. Not like I just left my room door open, they checked somone into our occupied room and used their master key to open up our safe!!! " They could have at least offered a complementary breakfast or supper at the least to help us out for our trouble. They did not offer us anything. So now i was missing my sunglasses because of all the moves and not going to get compensated for my loss, wasn't my fault I had to make so many moves if they would have done things correctly the first time. Also upon touring around we came back to our room to find the maids had not cleaned it, so now we had to ask for new towels, soaps and shampoos. The guy at reception then argued with me that maybe we had the sign on the wrong side.... AGAIN i was 100% confident that i didn't. I went upstairs and looked at the sign and it was clearly on "clean my room"!! Don't know why this guy liked to argue so much. Day 4 - They reimbursed us our 10 EUR for our snacks they lost, but nothing else, we consumed hours dealing with our issues on OUR HOLIDAY, which really frustrated me, not like were were in Barcelona for a few weeks, 4 days isn't alot so 4-5 total hours dealing with issues is not fun. To summarize, we moved rooms 3 times, had my sunglasses lost during these moves, had to go buy snacks again, didn't get our room cleaned and had to go back and forth for supplies, Management should realize things like this are very annoying when on holidays. No compensation for our lost time or just to say "I'm sorry we inconvenienced you they way we did" it was an ok stay, the room we finally had was loud, lots of screaming at nights and traffic going back and forth. Other than Sarah, the rest of the people did not communicate well and did not follow through on much. They are very friendly and helpful but just did not know how to deal with problems. So if you have problems you will see the lack of knowledge and customer service. They never asked us ever our names, so it was obvious we could just say we were in a certain room and they would have given us the room key. Very poor security. Not to harp on it too much, but when traveling internationally, certain valuables and passports are your prized possessions, and to have them just open up your safe and leave it open is just WRONG. Overall, for the price we paid, and after knowing the streets and noise issues, etc, I would likely have stayed closer to La Ramblas as there are literally hundreds of hotels around there. I know i had a choice of about 10 highly rated trip advisor hotels within the $10-20 of eachother, next time I will try them out instead. I liked the people at Casanova but I would personally want to find a a hotel that can deal professionally with problems when they arise, I just don't feel they are that competent when it comes to deal with issues, especially SECURITY issues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great location”
Reviews.Author: GenuineJudge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very unassuming and you might miss it outside as there is no real sign howvever it is a classic example of a fantasic boutique hotel. Rooms are a great size, clean and have an excellent climate control system. There is a mini bar so no need to worry about stocking up on water, shower, bath and very modern interior with a safe. The rooms facing the inner courtyard are so quiet and this is hard to find in a city. The hotel is about 15 minutes walk from las ramblas and very close to universtat. There are great restaurants near by and its situated very close to urgel metro stop. Its cost approx 25-30 euro to barcelona airport and if using Reus travel to sants bus station and take a bus to reus airport allow 1 1/2 hours of travelling time. A bus is usually waiting outside of Reus to take you to Sants station in the city after Ryanair flights. The staff in this hotel are excellent and very accomodating as tou can leave your luggage,, book a taxi and leave your travel documents in the downstairs safe after checkout. This hotel is excellent and the beds are so comfortable!!!! Well worth a stay and certainly worth its four stars....Reccomendations.....tea and coffee making facilities in the room..

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: NoamKiedis
Reviews.Content: we spent a week at Casanova and loved every minute. the room was very clean, the bathroom was amazing and once you close the window you enjoy a very quiet night sleep. there was a powerful air conditioner. the tv was good but there was not much to watch. breakfast was nice, but there was no real variety of vegetables. the hotel is 5 minutes walk from a metro station (universitat) and pg Gracia, and 7 mins walk from placa Catalunya and La Rambla. the best thing about the hotel was the terrific staff! they were very polite, patient and helpful. every request we had was filled with a smile. (they made phone calls, google searched, printed info, gave maps, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, safe and modern”
Reviews.Author: cheesem0nster
Reviews.Content: A great base from which to explore Barcelona. Clean, safe, quiet hotel just 10 mins walk from plaza catalunya. Free Internet is ADSL only, wifi costs £15 per day. Breakfast is a bit of a rip off but there's plenty of mini-marts and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good value just off the city center”
Reviews.Author: MaxGS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casanova Hotel for 4 nights in July 2010. On the plus side, the hotel is very modern and stylish. Our room was spacious and clean, and so was the bathroom. The air-conditioning was working, which is very important since the temperatures can get quite high in the summer. The staff was friendly and helpful, although they managed to mix-up our key cards a couple of times and we had to go down to reception to get them fixed (which only took a minute or two) to be able to get back into our room. Breakfast was nice with a fair variety and was included in the price (which was great because most hotels we were looking at when looking to book charged an extra fee in the region of EUR 20 per person per day). The restaurant is also quite good and offers a good selection of tapas. In terms of location, the hotel is not more than 5 minutes walk from University Square, where you can get on the metro... or get a Starbucks coffee! You can walk to Catalunia Square within 10 minutes or so and from there you can get on to La Rambla or one of the sightseeing buses which will take you round the main sights of the city. Taxis are quite cheap and you can get them anywhere. If you are using a taxi to get to the airport, the receptionist at the hotel wil be happy to call one for you, but make sure you have plenty of time to spare as our taxi was about 10 minutes late due to early morning traffic. Overall we were happy with our stay at the Casanova hotel, although I would go for a hotel closer to Plaza Catalunia for our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dippyclaire
Reviews.Content: Great location between two central metro stops and about 10-15 minute walk to La Rambla. Stylish interior and good size room - one of the best we have had in a city hotel. Lovely bathroom. Breakfast was a little chaotic (coffee request forgotten about, food running low etc.) but only a small issue. If you are really senstive to noise the rooms at the front have traffic noise (as overlook one of the busiest roads through the city) but this didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Kavit
Reviews.Content: The casanova is very convientantly located a 3 min walk from the metro, and about a 10 min walk to las ramblas. It is clean, modern and comfortable. The bathroom is a bit dark as stated in previous reviews, but other than that, its fine. Housekeeping comes early, so make sure to put your sign up if you don't want to be disturbed at 8am. I had initially requested a room facing the inner courtyard, but they instead gave me a room facing the street where I was woken up at 6am after traveling for nearly 2 days by some protesters and police. I then complained to the front desk who did switch my room, however, this should not have had to happen. The hotel would have received top rankings from me other than this. Also, know that this hotel is part of the gay district, something I was unaware of prior to booking.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have picked a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: moore2cl99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. The rooms were very clean and decently sized. Every single staff member was exceptionally friendly and always willing to go out of their way to help or make recommendations for sightseeing or restaurants, etc. A pool is scheduled to go in next year and that would be the only thing I would say is missing. Four of the major buslines stop directly in front of the hotel and the metro stop is a three minute walk away. This hotel made our anniversary trip to Barcelona completely unforgettable! The free breakfast in the morning was really good and with plenty of options.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, excellent value, good location, I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_L_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I really liked the modern feel of this hotel, all decorated in blacks/greens/creams/browns. The rooms had a very minimalist/trendy decor and the bathroom was lovely. The beds (double room has two single beds pushed together) were extremely comfortable and the airconditioning could be set to very warm or absolutely freezing cold, which was divine in the July heat of Barcelona. The hotel is very well located in between Urgell and Universtat metro stops (can get out at either) and these stops can take you to any location at all within the city. It is a 15 minute walk to La Ramblas. There is a lovely little sandwich shop across from the hotel which does great deals on sandwiches with drinks during the day. It is much more expensive to eat down at La Ramblas. The staff on the front desk were very helpful, especially the woman (working there on morning of Tuesday 20th July). I had a slight problem with one other male receptionist who came across as very abrupt and unhelpful, telling me simply to get a taxi to the airport rather than providing me with details of the much much cheaper Aerobus. Eventually he gave me incorrect information regarding this bus but overall it was a very small incident, rectified by the female receptionist. On the point of the Aerobus, I found that it was very difficult to actually pinpoint where the bus stop was as it is not clearly marked. It is on the street parallel to Gran Via but be sure to get good directions in advance. This hotel was excellent value (£195 for three nights on hotelpronto) and if I was ever coming to Barcelona again I would simply book it again without even looking at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel-great location-but noisey”
Reviews.Author: LindaGld
Reviews.Content: After traveling around Spain, came back to Barcelona and booked this hotel last minute to spend an extra 2 days. (1st hotel which was El Palace -great hotel-see review) . Overall, hotel is great location-close walk to everything we wanted to be near-shopping at Gracia, the city center and an easy walk to the old gothic barri. Right near the university so we had every bus route available to us which was easy to navigate. Liked this area alot for it was more lively...alot of late night cafes right next to us-the Antoni strip was nice to have...gave a "downtown & hip" feel. Lots of great cafes 2 blocks away as well. As much as we loved location. Howeve, trhe last night there was when Spain won the world cup and this hotel defintiely does not have sound proof doors. Was on the 4th floor, off to the side and had two sleepless nights. The biggest hint before we went to bed the first night (besides the local sound of the cars & people) was the two sets of ear plugs that they had boxed nicely in the closet. The room was very modern as was the bathroom. The hotel overall was very modern & hip in a beautiful old builidng. As much as I really like the hotel, rooms, evening staff (day staff abit abrupt) and the location, I would not stay at this hotel simply because of the noise issue. When a hotel has to delicately leave you ear plugs I woul dthink it's time to consider renovating the terrace doors for soundproofing. If you can sleep through anything then definitely book this hotel-its very nice and location ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: jay35h
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel at a reasonable price for the area. Very modern feel and the location was so close to La Ramblas. Would go to Barcelona again and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a short break”
Reviews.Author: purpleturtle777
Reviews.Content: Location Good, within walking distance of many bars, restaurants and underground station. Rooms Quite small but decorated to a high standard with modern finishes and colour, wooden floors, comfortable bed, mini bar, flat screen TV with a variety of channels but no in house movies or internet. Large bathroom with separate shower & bath. Nice bathrobes and slippers. very important it was quiet, no noise from elevators, road traffic or other guests. View not great - looking inward to a central courtyard. Very Clean. Service Reception was fine checking in & out, the hotel staff were generally helpful. We requested an iron one evening which was promptly delivered, other than than we never really needed any assistance from the hotel staff. Restaurant & Bar Both areas were very comfortable, modern and clean. Breakfast was fine although the selection of food on offer was quite limited in comparison with many other hotels we have stayed at. It was however fresh and well presented and the breakfast staff were very helpful.The bar area was very relaxing at night, not many people around so did lack a little atmosphere. Drinks were expensive, Vodka & coke around nearly 10Euro. We did not dine in the restaurant at night. This is a stylish, well presented hotel in a good location. The staff are helpful when required and the rooms are comfortable and quiet. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very contemporary”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night after our RCI cruise. Featured in Sovereign, Superbreak and others. Hotel about a 10 minute walk from Catalunya Square and the top of Las Ramblas via two straight roads with good pavements. Not a bad postion. Guy on reception very smiley but bar waitress the opposite. The hotel is ultra modern and maybe a little too dark as it is very minimalist. the corridors where the bedrooms are are dark wood so you feel a little closed in. Breakfast was nice, better than I have had in barcelona before and the fixtures and fittings very modern and clean. I would stay there again and reccommend to friends and family but only those that like really modern chic surrroundings as it could be a bit too stark for some. The developed area of the waterfront is gorgeous and I loved Barcelona itself its perfect for a short break. the buildings are interesting and we did a tour whereby we saw the olympic ring and view of BCN from Montjuic Hill which was fab. Very nice in all.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Central Location, Barr is expensive but i guess so is everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: VillaNapa
Reviews.Content: The title says it all, The Spa is a spa no swimming facilities and is difficult to find, rooms are nice and fresh and the bar reception area is very airy and nice. The location is great being a 10 minute walk from las ramblas and i would recommend catching the AeroBus to and from the airport for 5 euros! Trains and Metro etc is a few minutes walk away. I would return to this hotel in an instant! Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: CeliaB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casanova for the first time for a four night break. We stayed in the junior suite, which was lovely and I am the most fussy person around. I always believe that if you are paying to stay somewhere it should be better than you own home. Well, we were not disappointed. The suite was modern, well appointed and clean with plenty of room to wind down and relax after trawling the city all day. The location was good too, only 10 minutes walk to Las Ramblas. The reception staff were extremely helpful, showing us the best places in the city. I also booked tickets to the Barcelona game, which were being delivered direct to the hotel. The hotel staff were very helpful in contacting the company to ensure they were delivered on time. The breakfast was vey substantial too, the waiter even remembered my poached egg order without my even having to ask. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location, indifferent service, horrible lighting”
Reviews.Author: msmithNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Luxury Link and I must say it is not up to the usual standards of a hotel they would list. First, even after several confirming emails regarding airport pick up they did not have a car waiting for us - we took a cab and told the front desk to pay which they did. The jusior suite, while lovely, had horrific lighting - reading in bed was near impossible and you absolutely could not put make-up on with the glare in the bathroom. The location was good - the "concierge" very uninformed - had their few standard recommendations and nothing else.... The massage was wonderful and the breakfasts more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice size room and great location”
Reviews.Author: my0000
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel is a great location, within walking distance to Plaça de Catalunya and La Rambla. Good size room, plenty of room to move around. The bathroom is also very roomy with a rain shower. Breakfast is good (included in the room rate), plenty of selections. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The only one drawback is the balcony door. There are doors leading to the balcony, the inside one doesn't have a handle and required a key to lock/unlock the door. We had it lock so it has better sound proof.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: brtoy
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in March. Front Desk Staff was very friendly and helpful. We checked in on a Saturday. We had to wait about an hour for our room and the front desk was nice enough to store our luggage. Our room was on the 2nd floor facing the Grand Via. It was supposed to be a non-smoking room but it smelled like smoke. The room had French doors but the handle was broken. I thought maybe that was intentional for safety reasons but we had to move to another room the next day because our tv didn't work and they couldn't get parts on a Sunday. It was on the 3rd floor with french doors that opened up onto a small balcony. The second room did not smell like smoke. I was told that they only had one smoking floor, I believe the 5th floor, but guests smoked in non-smoking rooms. Our rate included breakfast. We had an assortment of meats,cheeses, Spanish Omlet, pastries along with juices, milk and coffee. We didn't notice until the second day at breakfast that near the hostess station was an American Breakfast with scrambled eggs and bacon. They do have free internet access for a 2 hour period and I was given a laptop to connect in the room. Connectivity was sporatic and I couldn't get it to work. The location is 5 min. walking distance to La Rambla. There are many shops and restaurants in the area. We picked up some snacks at a Supercat Grocery store on the same block. There is also a bakery across the street. It was a nice hotel, great location and I'd recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hits all the right notes”
Reviews.Author: minky35
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a perfect location minutes from Place de Catalunya and the Gothic Quarter. Coming from the airport get off at either Urgell or Universitat and the hotel is a couple of minutes walk on the main street. Impressive building with the focal point on a corner where two streets meet. Very plush lobby and cool hotel bar decked in green lighting. The rooms are fabulous. We got a second floor right on the corner overlooking the main street. It was laid out on two levels, the first being the storage area and bathroom with the bedroom and balcony a couple of steps lower down. The bathroom is probably one of the most amazing ever. To the right of the toilet and sink is a separate walk in wet room with power rain shower. Everything in the bathroom is elegant and sturdy not like some of the plastic pods you can get in some hotels. Very comfortable beds, plenty of storage and good lighting arrangements. Shame there are no coffee / tea making facilities but the staff can provide boiling water free of charge. Internet access is free via ADSL or chargeable via wi-fi. Ask the staff for the correct configuration settings if you experience any problems with the LAN cable. Overall, the hotel is superbly situated, elegant and stylish. It is in a great neighbourhood with plenty of shops, cafes and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Overheated Room, staff who couldn't care less”
Reviews.Author: BristolMum85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husband's 40th birthday. The hotel itself is very modern, trendy, beautifully designed and lit. Our room was small, but this didn't matter as we spent very little time in it. The one HUGE issue was that our room was heated to an unbearable temperature and the staff said they could do nothing about it. They claimed that the hotel was designed so that you could either have the heating on OR the air con on. You therefore couldn't have the heating on and then tune your air con the right levels for you and your family to be comfortable. None of us could sleep. We had to leave the balcony door open all day and all night to even get a slight cooling of the room. Then the traffic noise kept us awake instead. It was such a shame as otherwise it is a lovely hotel. The members of staff we spoke to couldn't really give a toss and simply handed me a comments slip to fill out. Not good enough, we certainly couldn't recommend it to anybody as the heating made our stay so uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for travelling with baby”
Reviews.Author: newak
Reviews.Content: Just had to drop a line to TripAdvisor on this hotel, as we searched for ages to try to find a hotel in Barcelona that we could stay at for one night with our 5 month old baby. For others that are struggling with the same problem, this may well be your answer. Although we were only there for one night, and for various reasons did not venture out in the evening, the location seemed to be very good. There were certainly bars and restaurants around which looked to be good value and quality. Also a supermarket nearby if you need baby supplies! We did venture into Barcelona the next day, and the main sites are easily walkable (about 15 minutes to La Rambla/cathedral etc). Car parking is available, staff were helpful, cot provided. Rooms were not huge, but comfortably fit the three of us. Bathroom and shower were excellent. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Simple elegance with a friendly and knowledgeable staff.”
Reviews.Author: bernmcn
Reviews.Content: My prerequisites for a hotel room while traveling is that it be clean and the beds comfortable. This hotel met that criteria and so much more. The decorations are tasteful, pleasing to the eye and never overdone; the rooms were comfortable and well-appointed. The hotel staff was gracious and couldn't be more helpful. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't really complain!!!!”
Reviews.Author: leeroyberyl
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, very modern, I actually thought the reception staff were very helpful and in particular, Daniele. Very disappointed that there was no tea or coffee making facilities in the bedroom although we were upgraded for free and had an amazing room. The beds are to die for. Bathroom was not a bathroom. It was a MICRO bathroom. Fab location and easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Had some significant issues. Long Read.”
Reviews.Author: NEFAST
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking my trip, I read many reviews about this hotel on tripadvisor, and based on the positive reviews, booked a room for 4 nights in Barcelona. We did not request the breakfast at an additional charge. The room is small but comfortable and clean. My gripe with them was with other issues, mainly having to do with the customer service. When I arrived, I wanted to connect to the internet to make a Skype call to the U.S., only to struggle to connect - they have an ethernet landline available that was included in the price of the room, not Wifi. Called reception on two separate ocassions asking them if there was anything I needed to do - set up a log in, password, etc. They said, "just plug in the cord and you should be able to connect". My Wife called again and asked the same thing. Continued to play with the computer to see if I could connect and called reception again to ask them if they could send someone up to help me and they said no one was there to help me with that and that all computers are different and they couldn't do anything. After almost two hours of trying to connect and not being able to connect, we went out to spend the afternoon around Plaza Catalunya and get something to eat. When we returned that evening, I tried for another 30 minutes to connect until I got fed up and went down to the reception, to let them know I NEEDED to connect to the internet and had requested assistance three times previously and had received no help. There were three people at the reception desk at that moment. Two of them were unsure about how to help me and could not do anything. The last person was helping someone else at that moment, but we he finished, he handed me a sheet of paper on how to configure my IP address in order to be able to connect. At that time, and only at that moment, did the lady behind the counter say - "oh, is your computer from the United States? We seem to have this problem a lot with people who come from the United States. If you configure the computer using these directions, you will be able to connect, no problem". I gave them a short and polite, but very pissed off "thank you" and went to the room where I was able to connect within 5 minutes. Thank you Casanova Hotels for wasting 3 hours of my trip to Barcelona, just so I could connect to the internet to check on my 1-1/2 year old son and mother entrusted with his care during our trip. During this whole time, they also offered me a Wifi card, for 9 Euro an hour, so I could connect wirelessly. So the lesson here is, landlines may be tricky, or this particular hotel's internet configuration was tricky, but the issue was how they dealt with my request for help. And also I learned make sure the hotel say WIRELESS internet connection included so I don't have to try to guess how to configure my computer to connect to the internet. Sorry, Casanova - I forgot my crystal ball at home so I could magically decipher how to connect to your network. My other gripe was the room service food, but this was our own fault. After spending the whole day walking from site to site, we were exhausted one night and decided just to get room service. Terrible idea. But, once again, our own fault. Who gets room service in Barcelona when there are so many amazing places to eat? Well, we were just wiped out from the day and thought we could have a quick bite and go to bed early. We figured "how bad could it be"? The answer was: Bad. The food was just not good, but more importantly: They put some condiments on the room service tray - ketchup, mustard, mayo. Two of them were open and had previously been used. The kitchen decided it was ok to close the lids on them and just send them back up to another seemingly unsuspecting hotel guest. You want to know how I knew they were used? Aside from the seal being broken on the lids - the mayo had a glob of ketchup frmo the last guy who as scooping up his burger, or whatever he was eating. Needless to say, we lost our appetite. At this point, what's one to do? If these are the hotel practices, the complaining will not do anything to fix it. It didn't help much with my previous issue, but I figure I can warn others so you will take this information into consideration when evaluating this hotel. Aside from that, I guess the place was ok. In essence, if you don't require the internet, food, or any semblance of customer service, then this place is great!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice trendy hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: samiam1980
Reviews.Content: Nice trendy hotel, clean, safe, large bathrooms, cozy beds, cute lounge. Overall this was a very pleasant experience. I recommend one of the delicious cocktails at the bar served by a very charming young lady from Poland, (she was actually one of my favorite people I met on this trip).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and excellent service with style”
Reviews.Author: Lou_Mike
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit for us. The hotel is in an excellent location and we loved the decor. Service was good. Beds were really comfy and pillows were divine - we all wanted to take them home with us!

Reviews.Title: “great place & location”
