Reviews.Author: jgpe
Reviews.Content: what a nice very clean hotel! staff are great very helpful. rooms are really nice & compy beds! stayed with my boyfriend as a 21st birthday gift. its about 5 mins walk to la ramblas, easy to get around to everywhere from here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, except for unpleasant smell in the room!”
Reviews.Author: maf-9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in August. Pros: The room and bathroom were large, clean, stylish and comfortabe. The buffet breakfast was very good. The location was good, close enough to Plaza Catalynua. Free cable high speed internet. Free bottle of water in the room (only 2 from the 5 days, who knows why?). Stylish hotel in general. Good value for money for Barcelona. Cons: Very unpleasant smell that did not go away, coming from the bathroom and spreading all over the room (the window did not open). A lot of street noise in the first floor. They were very stingy with the bath amenities, one day the did not leave us soap and we had to wash our hands with the shampoo. Personnel not very helpful. There was no remote control in our room and we had to ask two days in a row until they brought us one (that did not work). In general, except from the smell all other problems were really minor, at least for us. Nevertheless they are not acceptable for a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 2 Nights on way to Mediterreanean Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Dennis14years
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel located near Metro Stations. Can be noisy as it is in the Heart of things on a main Barcelona Street. Room nice size for Europe.If back would likely try another hotel but all in all aok.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: pgowlding
Reviews.Content: Stopped at this hotel through default. Picked out a deal at Me Barcelona through travel zoo. Arrived Me Hotel with booking reference - only to find out booking was non existent. After a phone call back to the UK this hotel was recommended via Travelzoo. It turned out that this hotel was better located with a far friendlier approach to guests than the way out of the way Me Hotel. the hotel is located on one of the main roads in Barcelona but the rooms are well noise proofed and the traffic noise is negligible. The staff were courteous and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. The hotel rooms are nicely presented though smaller than average, but at the end of the day you're not in Barcelona to sit in your room are you. The bedding is changed daily (you can be green and opt out of this) and cleaned well. The nearest metro stop is 5 minutes walk away from the hotel door in the Placa Universidad or at Uguell. The area is safe, but be aware, if your travelling with kids you may have to field questions about some of the shops in the area, as although not sleazy, this is the gay area of town with associated skimpy underwear shops and the likes (nudge, nudge say no more!!) My only gripe if you can call it a gripe, is the breakfast is very samey samey and does get monotonous after day three, but again, there are plenty of places to grab breakfast at in the locality. Definately would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business or leisure for couples/friends in their thirties!”
Reviews.Author: Pykmin
Reviews.Content: Transport/Location: The hotel position is very good, close to 2 metro stations, all the main tourist attractions are at hand. Of course you might need to change a couple of lines (Barcelona has 5 lines) in order to reach your destination. Cleanliness: nothing to complain about. Internet connection is free, if you have your own laptop and cable you just plug it in and ready to go, for wireless I think it's a bit more complicated. We used cable connection and worked perfectly. As we were there for a wedding, we asked to iron our clothes, were given iron & ironing board and we did it ourselves, no problem at all. We paid for breakfast 16 €, we were offered full + continental breakfast: it's good because they didn't overdo, I mean, I often find a too exasperated range of choice, here there was just what you needed. Refined, very modern atmosphere/design, green, relaxing lighting. It clashed with the 80's (cheesy) music selection, even though I enjoyed it, but it just didn't match the no-frills atmosphere. On our last night we enjoyed a Micheal Jackson tribute night @ the bar area (BTW we left at 3 and the party was still on!). Minor flaws: lack of hooks around the room and the hair-dryer that was (I think) a little bit broken, but working. The sight from the room balcony was amazing. Odd (maybe not for Spain though), check in was @ 2 pm and check out @ 1 pm. I would definetely recommend this hotel for business or leisure trips to couples/friends in their thirties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suites--perfect for travel with 2 young kids”
Reviews.Author: pickyatltraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is in a great location, very modern, the suites are great!!! The staff provided us with a crib for the baby and an extra bed for our preschooler for 20 euros a night. The nice thing about the suite is that the bedroom is completely separate from the living area. There are also 2 bathrooms. The restaurant was very good for dinner--the breakfast was only ok (it was included with our trip so no complaints). European hotels can be gross, so I would be careful booking. We had a bad experience with another barcelona hotel, but this one was very nice. The spa was only mediocre, I have to say even though it has a nice atmosphere . Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. It was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker2224
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Casonova Hotel in Barcelona. Room was very comfortable and clean. Rooms at the back of the hotel overlooking the courtyard were very quiet. Staff were extremely helpful and everyone that we dealt with spoke English. Hotel was in a good location - walking distance to Placa de Catalunya and La Rambla. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel and we found it expensive but there are plenty of cafes around that were cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: stalin777
Reviews.Content: Very plush hotel, great location. Staff was over the top nice/helpful. The overnight clerk was one of the nicest people we have met traveling, accommodated our after hours request for a cork screw, by searching through the hotel bar for 20 minutes before retrieving it. Rooms are nice (Bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in), view is ok. No rooftop terrace except for spa. I have to agree w/ some other reviews that the design of the bathrooms is.....interesting. Very dark, but its a bathroom so who really cares.

Reviews.Title: “Tops them all!”
Reviews.Author: marcoaz
Reviews.Content: Smashing suite with two toilets 2 tv's roomy great decor. Very functional. The restaurant food is great. Lobby bar is great for people watching. Staff ultra friendly and multi lingual and very helpful. Location is great for strolling to main tourist sights. The spa gives great massages! Matches the magnificence of Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean, modern, walking dist to Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Linda232323
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 days pre-cruise and 4 days post-cruise. The staff is very helpful with directions, and any requests. The room pre-cruise wa on the street side with a small balconey which was nice but that was one of the nights of the games so people were celebrating and honking horns all night so we requested a room in the back on our return and it was very quite, but no view. I would recommend this hotel, it is a short walk to Ramblas, very well maintained and very modern. I would stay here again, & I am quite fussy about where we stay. The bathroom was quite large and bedroom good size for Europe standards

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly comfortable...Quiet...Great place to rest in busy, loud city.”
Reviews.Author: Alaboys
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms...Quiet...Close to metro stop with grocery, cafes on the way. Bus stops in front of hotel. VERY modern...we didn't even know we had a second half-bath until end of trip. Staff helpful with travel information. Felt very secure and comfortable. Great linens and water pressure!

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear of this place”
Reviews.Author: JMCRutland
Reviews.Content: We had a superior room on the 7th floor. There was a constant stench of sewage in the bathroom, the drains are not properly vented. Black mold and mildew on the shower walls. Tiny corner windows only natural light - and interior lighting an awful design, can't really see the closets, can't read except in bed and then the lights burn so hot it's uncomfortable. The place seems like it's on the verge of bankruptcy or something... front desk staff marginally helpful. No laundry on weekends or holidays, so after a week of traveling before we arrived, we could not get any clothes cleaned and had to wash in the sink and try to dry them by hanging near the tiny little windows. I'd never get close to this place again, it's awful. And they sure didn't ask us anything about our stay once, including at check out. They could clearly care less. Barcelona is great and the location is good but there are far nicer hotels than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Had lots of promise but no atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Taba30
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 day trip to Barcelona and we stayed at this hotel. On arrival to our room the door to the balcony did not open and the window was badly cracked. We reported this straight away and were told that they would look into it. my partner thanked them and said there was no hurray as we would like to freshen up and head out for dinner so asap would be fine. On our return much later nothing had been done. We queried this with reception in the morning and they were very apologetic but explained the handyman wasn't in till Monday.We were happy with that and thanked them. They did very kindly offer to move us to another room on the 2nd floor but it was much smaller and weren't able to access the Balcony for health and safety reasons so seemed little point. The decor was very modern and vibrant and the lighting was dim and subtle and created a relaxed atmosphere. The standadrd room was small but nicely furnished and the bathroom was fab with a mirrored wall and subdued lighting (always more flattering than harsh strip lighting!!! no pun intended) The flat screen TV in the room was a dissappointment though as the reception was poor and for english speakers you could only get CNN or Bloomberg - very orientated towards business users. The hotel bar staff were generally very knowledgeable and could make a wide variety of cocktails although they must have been training a couple of new bar men who didn't know what or how to make a "Kir Royale" The hotel was close to two Metro stops and getting about was not a problem The spa at the hotel is tucked a way in a junior suite on floor 2 and is expensive - I recommend that you visit the Hammam (turkish bath spa) off Avenue Diagonal for a more holistic and value for money spa experience. Overall a great hotel but as it was quite a quiet week there wasn't much of an atmosphere in the hotel and it felt far too quiet - I suspect as the summer season progresses further things will pick up

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharon2906
Reviews.Content: Spent Easter in Barcelona and chose the Casanova. It's not the cheapest hotel but it's very well-maintained and in a good location (about 10 minutes' stroll from the Placa Catalunya). Our room was large with a good-sized bathroom. Everything was spotlessly clean and it all worked. The breakfast buffet was great with lots of choice and the staff were all very helpful and nice. Would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of going to Barcelona. Enjoyed our stay and had some lovely meals out. We had dinner at Botiga (good food, relaxed atmosphere) and Brown (good food, slightly more formal) and both were really nice. There are two city tour bus companies but the Bus Turista (3 different routes) is much busier and doesn't actually go to any other places than the Barcelona tourist bus. Tip for anyone going to Barcelona and staying in the area : take the airport bus from the airport into the City. It was really convenient and only 7.30 euros return.

Reviews.Title: “A Breath of Fresh Air”
Reviews.Author: eclipsy84
Reviews.Content: After spending three nights in a horrible hotel on the same street, checking into the Casanova was a dream come true. The staff was excellent; I cut myself and when I went down to the front desk for a band aid a staff member actually put the band aid on me himself. The room was great; plush comfortable bed, more pillows then you could ever need, huge floor to ceiling windows, rainfall shower head. The restaurant was pretty well priced for a hotel, although it didn't open until 8:00 PM for dinner. One complaint is that the room phone was on the fritz, and was never fixed or replaced. A hotel of its caliber in New York would probably be $100 more.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: mabtx
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The best location in the city -- away from the excessive, rowdy tourist, yet one block from the Metro. Great restaurants within walking distance. Very contemporary. A real queen-size bed was such a treat -- not 2 twin beds pushed together! Stayed there a week and would do it again

Reviews.Title: “cosmopolitan”
Reviews.Author: glam-o-puss
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel with 2 friends we were in barcelona for a 40th celebration ! had a fantastic trip and barcelona is a fantastic city...highly recommend the gaudi trail...altho not there long enough to do it all. highly recommend the tapas bar at the top of the ramblas on the right as you go down...the spanish/american lady in there is a great hostess !!!! the casanova hotel is modern clean and comfortable and would definitely stay there again. it is a hotspot for the gay community but what a laugh we had as someone held a party in the bar our first night there...the resident djay looks like austin powers !! all the staff were very accomodating...cant wait to go again !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: rji1962
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Barcelona after staying at the Casanova. We booked on the reccomendations on TA and as ever they were accurate. Very modern hotel with clean rooms (but no tea making facilities which seemed a bit odd) and a very good bar. Good location as 5 or so minutes walk to the Playa Catalunya and near to University metro stop. If arriving by the Aerobus (which is a very good, cheap and efficient service) from El Prat airport then alight at the University stop or have a longer walk if you get off at Catalunya! The reception staff are first class and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “From what we could see, great”
Reviews.Author: escottf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in January (winter in Barcelona) and it seemed fine from what we took advantage. Basically, we only used it as a place to sleep - and in that regard it was great. Good room, great bathroom, plenty of channels to watch on the TV and not too noisy. Not huge, but typical sized for Europe and very stylish and modern. The reception staff seemed fine. The only thing worthy of note is the location - on a map it seems handy but it is a bit of a walk (when you have luggage) from the Plaza Catalunya , Passeig de Gracia and the Rambla. It's close to Universitat Metro station (where, apparently the airport bus stops) but we came from the Passeig de Gracia RENFE (train) station (which you can catch from the airport) which was a bit of a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the start we had hoped for...”
Reviews.Author: gavstergav
Reviews.Content: Having looked around, I booked this hotel as it was one of the "Small Luxury Hotels in the World" chain, and had very good reviews on this site. I called directly and booked a Deluxe room with the Front of House manager, emphasising that this was the first break my wife and I would have alone since the birth of our daughter almost two years ago and we wanted a quiet room at the top. I was assured that all Deluxe rooms face internally into the courtyeard, and they would make the stay special. We arrived, big surprise for my wife (she thought we were staying at a friend's apartment), and checked in. On arrival to the room, I realised immediately that it was the basic level room and, worse, it was facing the street. I called down to tell them that a mistake had been made, and they asked to call me back. They did so within ten minutes, and basically said, yes, a mistake had been made, but there were no deluxe rooms available but they would give us a "better" standard room and breakfast thrown in for free. This wasn't good enough. I went down to the desk and emphasised that I had booked this directly through them and expected to be upgraded, or worst case scenario, found a superior room in a partner hotel. I have to say that the people I dealt with were extremely polite and courteous, and once they realised that I wasn't going to accept their original offer - which took some stressing - they said they would make every effort to accommodate us. We went for lunch and they said they would call me. I got a call within the hour saying that we would be upgraded to the next level above Deluxe, the Junior Suite - result! We continued our lunch, very happy. On return to the hotel, I was told that they weren't giving us a Junior Suite, but a Deluxe was available and they had moved us there. At this point, I didn't really want to argue the toss anymore, as it would otherwise spoil what was meant to be a romantic getaway. We had what we had booked, after a bit of an argument, and I feel that many other hotels just wouldn't have made this much of an effort to sort it out. The Deluxe room was great, nice modern layout and feel, and the manager had had the good sense to leave a bottle of champagne on ice to await us. The staff on the whole were exemplary, the cleaning service great. The one complaint about the rooms is that the doors are not soundproofed, so if there is a connecting door between your room and the one next door, then you can hear what's going on there. The location is good, ten minutes from Las Ramblas and less than five to the La Ravel, everywhere is eminently walkable. Without the rather negative experience at the start of the trip, I would have recommended this hotel without hesitation. As it is, I still do - but with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel -- trying hard to please”
Reviews.Author: devoted_guy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Casanova for 5 nights in late Nov-08 following a few days in Paris. I booked the hotel via their on-line website. I had informed them that we would be arriving very late on Friday evening and to hold the room for us upon arrival. Previous comments on Tripadvisor were quite true. Modern hotel, very good location near Universitat Metro station and 10 minute walk (past Starbucks for the morning java) to La Rambla. Very noisy bar scene on the main floor on weekend nights so be sure to ask for a room higher up. The room was, indeed, very dark -- but that's the decor of the hotel room. Black / brown walls and not much lighting around the room. As noted on Trip Advisor, I think the shower pressure was the best I've ever found in a European hotel. We did, however, experience a few issues for which the hotel did attempt to resolve. We came back to our room late on Sunday evening and found the hotel room door propped open by the door bolt. Needless to say, we weren't amused. We contacted the hotel front desk and asked for someone to come up to the room to explain. The head housekeeper did come up and profusely apologize for the mistake -- she had done it herself as a reminder to another maid to do something in the room -- and had forgotten to close and lock the door. She was very embarrassed and apologized again and again, but with all the petty crime issues one reads about in Barcelona, you can only imagine our concern. Luckily, I had locked up everything of value in the hotel room safe. The hotel did, in fact, send up a bottle of champagne as a token of apology. When checking out, I was informed that the hotel accepts euro-denominated travellers' cheques subject to a 3% service charge. I never recall having seen anything on the check-in form or on the on-line booking form or on the website. This is hotel policy and may, in fact, be a policy for all Barcelona hotels -- but shouldn't they advise the client ahead of time? I chose to purchase travellers' cheques (in euros) in advance of the trip because of the petty crime / theft concerns and didn't experience any problems using them in Paris a few days earlier. Had I known in advance, I would have arranged other means to settle my account as using my credit card proved very costly with double conversion charges from euros to U.S. dollars and then to Canadian dollars (the currency of my card). Anyways, the clerk was very apologetic again but I had to use my cc. Thirdly, I noted that the fee I was charged was higher than that which was quoted on the on-line site. I did email the hotel upon my arrival home, pointed out the discrepancy in charges and they did reverse the difference very promptly. As for internet connection, the hotel is wired for wireless connection and will even lend you a laptop computer to take up to your room for two yours to use and check your emails / browse the web. All in all, a very modern, well located, hotel with dark rooms and great shower pressure. My only complaint is that they should have advised us of the 3% euro travellers cheque surcharge in advance. Nice hotel staff. No concierge on site so if you're looking for restaurant recommendations / reservations, they weren't very accommodating -- you'll have to make your own choices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and lovely accomodation”
Reviews.Author: SydsidersinLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really lovely - great rooms, comfy beds, nice clean and modern bathrooms. But the real winner for the hotel is the staff and their attention to detail. They went out of their way to please us. We were given a room (lovely) but the airconditioning was set too high and couldn't be turned down, however opening the doors exposed us to traffic noise. When we asked if there was something they could do they quickly and pleasantly changed our room to something quieter and cooler. The staff were also helpful in directing us to local attractions and providing local information. Lovely little bar in the foyer for a night cap too! Would definitley recommend this place. As for the walk to La Ramblas....its only 10 mins max and you get to buy pass some traditional little tapas joints along the way where if you don't speak the language you just point and smile to get your food.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: clb1975
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a surprise for my boyfriends birthday, as I had never been to Barcelona wanted a hotel in a good location. And it was! After arriving off the airport bus at Cataluna square we easily got a taxi to the hotel at night. Seeing the hotel first at night was fantastic candles throughout the bar and into the recption made it very welcoming and romantic. Room was spilt level very modern even though we overlooked the front road noise was not an issue to us. Breakfast fantastic choice and replenished regulary even 15mins before closing. Walked every day to Cataluna Square where all sightseeing buses go from. Enjoyed drinks in the hotel bar not cheap but complimentry nibbles made up for it. Only gripe was wardrobe in room too small we were only there for 3 nights and struggled to fit our clothes in. Staff were excellant and friendly nothing to much for them even recommended beachfront restuarants near the port. Would definatley go back for value, location and the beauty of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nickray1
Reviews.Content: Good hotel on a good location. Very close to Place de Catalunia Stayed here for 3 days with the company I work for and would definitely go back next time.. Reason why the hotel doesn't get 5 stars is because of the bar personel. The guy behind the bar was not friendly, quite rude even. Prices are quite high as well... Should you go to Barca I would definitely recommend Club Opium in Barceloneta! Great Spot to have dinner and to go clubbing afterwards

Reviews.Title: “Modern-Stylish”
Reviews.Author: bonchoix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just west of Las Ramblas and about a ten minute walk to the nearest underground at Universitat. So it's pretty well located for getting around most of the popular attractions. Can't say i was overwhelmed by the reception staff and they seemed a little indifferent, but nothing too troublesome. The hotel is quite new, built in 2006. It's very stylish and modern and in the evening the giant sized candles that line the foyer are lit and give a nice ambiance. The room we had was again stylish and comfortable and i particularly liked the large walk in wet room type shower with mini bath and giant shower head! The room was a little on the small side but very comfortable and spotlessly clean and very nicely decorated if you like an ultra modern style. The only minor complaint i had about our particular room was that it was a little dark with not a great deal of natural light due to the fact that the long narrow window faced into an interior type court yard of the hotel, this probably works well in summer helping to keep the room cool, although the room has air conditioning. They have taken care to make the view from the window pleasant and positioned giant sized planters with colourful flowers just outside the window and these planters light up at night! I managed to glance into other rooms and noted that these were not as dark and had much larger windows. We took a room at the rear of the hotel as i had seen on this site that there may be a problem with noise. We had no problems and it was very quiet at night. Thought that the cocktails in the bar were a little overpriced at 9.50 for a small marguerita. We had a lovely meal in the restaurant and the food was fresh and well cooked. The staff on this occassion were very attentive but it wasn't very busy and again was a little dark! I would recommend this hotel for modern style and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dav1452
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The hotel is very centrally located and the interior decor is great. The one thing is that we were led to believe that the hotel is just 5 minutes from La Rambla. In reality, it used to take us about 20 minutes ... The breakfast was sumptuous. The reception and guest services staff were very helpful and helped us in making reservations for local shows. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, near Metro stop”
Reviews.Author: dkr1971
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Casanova for 3 nights with my wife. The room was large, and the bed was very comfortable. I've read a lot of reviews complaining about the noise. Our balcony faced a side street, and with the air conditioning on, I had no problem with the noise despite being a very light sleeper. The bathroom is extremely nice. The tub is huge, and has its own detachable showerhead separate from the overhead shower next to the tub. Both are inside the stall. I thought the location was good, its near the Urgell metro stop. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from Las Ramblas, which I thought was perfect. Its close enough to walk to easily, but far enough away from the crowds and noise. There is also a small supermarket across the street, which is very convenient. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Casanova!”
Reviews.Author: SwissTravelerZurich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casanova for five nights and were very happy. Great hall, very nice room. Maybe a bit on the dark side, due to the fact that it was facing the nicely designed yard (which is a good thing if you like peace and quiet). Staff is very nice and attentive, and food at the restaurant is also great. The bar itself ist a bit of a hot spot on weekends (they even have their own DJ). Don't expect great luxury or a lot of space in the rooms, but it is more than just adequate. We would strongly recommend the Casanova to anyone who likes staying central and enjoys some modern design! And as for thieves experienced by other travelers in the reviews below - it's a big city, like any other big town. So be watchful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenHaagTraveller
Reviews.Content: Firstly... if you are thinking of going to Barcelona, my advice is don't ! It's a crime ridden city. We were robbed three times in just 8 days... seriously. My partners handbag was stolen, money was taken from her pocket and money was also stolen from the room at the Casanova hotel, presumably by an employee. Coming back to the hotel, It's a clean and centrally located hotel with decent access to the city. It's far from cheap though, but nothing in Barcelona is. The standard rooms are adequate and I would not advise taking a deluxe. Try and get one at the back of the hotel though as you might not be able to sleep if you have a front room. The hotel provides everyone with ear plugs ! Food and drink here are expensive. It will cost you 5 Euros for a soft drink in the bar. The staff are friendly and efficient. However, this is a city full of thieving scumbags and i'm never going back. It wasn't that pretty anyway and there are better places to holiday than here.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel-wish I could stay here more often.”
Reviews.Author: Niks70
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel in 18 months and again I absolutely loved it. From the moment of arrival the service was second to none and at all times the staff were welcoming and could not do enough to help you and make your stay more enjoyable-even going so far as booking theatre tickets and a restaurant for us one night. The buffet breakfast was superb and could keep you going right until the evening although there are many excellent restaurants in Barcelona to keep tempting you for the duration of your stay.We enjoyed drinks in the bar every night and I can particularly recommend the liquer coffee as a nightcap!! All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in Barcelona that it central and makes the city more accessible-that is also clean,friendly and reasonably priced.if you are going make this your hotel of choice and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: markeman
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a trip to Spain and stayed at this hotel. The hotel is in a great location only a few blocks from La Rambla, only about a 10 minute walk. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive. Our Junior Suite was spacious with a small living room, extra bathroom for guests, and the master bath had a large shower and a tub. The room was spotless, which is very important to us. The hotel has a great bar and restaurant. The included breakfast was buffet style and very good, with Iberian ham, cheeses, smoked salmon, fresh fruit, lots of pastries, fresh squeezed juices, and they also would make eggs any style and other requested items. In general, I would highly recommend this hotel. If you value peace and quiet, this is a much better choice than some of the nice hotels in the heart of La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “a good choice”
Reviews.Author: alvoen
Reviews.Content: Stayed a long weekend (3 nights), 4 couples of 30+ yrs. Good location and base for exploring Barcelona (though quite a few taxi drivers did not know its location by name only...) Nice reception area with a bar and lounge, with cool Dj at w.end evenings. Excellent drinks in the bar, though abit pricey at Euro 10 each. Clean and modern rooms, nicely decorated. Might be worth asking for a room abit up as some traffic noise might be experienced at the lower floors. Overall: cool and highly recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Balcony belter”
Reviews.Author: snake11
Reviews.Content: Delightful stay at this central hotel with a balcony. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was quite modern, with an excellent bathroom with ceiling shower. The brochure promised a daily bottle of water and earplugs: the water arrived after three requests, but only the once, the earplugs never arrived, and are certainly needed if you're a light sleeper due to the traffic noise. Bath robes, however, arrived immediately on request. Breakfast was basic, but plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Dreadful service”
Reviews.Author: liliana_gar
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Hotel feeling that we had done a very good choice: nice deco, good location, good rooms. The reality it service was very poor. The staff were extremely inflexible to all our requests. On check out they told us that although we had a rate without breakfast they were going to do an exception for us and we could have breakfast. On the next day, when we came for breakfast we were advised that it was not going to be included - we were ok to pay for it, but the guy again said to us aloud that it was not included embarrasing us with the rest of the guests in the hotel. We asked if we could do late check out as our flght was not due until 10 pm, and not only they were not flexible (which is understandable) they just didnt try to find a way to help us so that we could take a shower before leaving the hotel. Overall - staff with bad mood, bad manners, and not willing to help. I wouldnt stay there again and would advise people against it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pucca_girl
Reviews.Content: Our party of 10 stayed in Barcelona for two nights - Monday 11-Wednesday 13th August. Since there were so many of us, we took a taxi from the airport which worked out cheaper and less hassle. The hotel itself was very clean, modern and trendy. All our rooms were beautifully furnished. I couldn't find any fault with the hotel or the rooms. Breakfast was included with our price and there was quite a lot to choose from - cereal, pastries, toast, cheese, hams, yoghurts, fruit, hot sausage, egg, bacon. The reception and bar staff were all very friendly and willing to help. The hotel manager even helped us find minivan hire for one of our daytrips. All in all, great hotel - good location - not too close to the hub of everything, but easily reachable via metro or walking.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: wondhols
Reviews.Content: We had booked the Silken Diagonal but after reading reviews on this site, and others, changed to the Casanova. We were really pleased with the hotel. The staff were very helpful and the location was perfect. Casanova is a modern boutique hotel and the location is within walking distance to Las Ramblas and Plaza de Catalunya, so it's very central to anything you might need. The area around the hotel offers a good selection of bars and restaurants and two subway stations are nearby. Breakfast offered a wide variety of choices, so something for everyone. As for the rooms, they were well presented, comfortable and the air conditioning was great. I'd recommend this hotel to everyone and my daughter is already planning a return trip with her friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKSKSK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights & I thought it was wonderful. The rooms were clean & very modern. The reception was very helpful & spoke many languages. Many people have written the rooms were loud, I didn't hear any noise at all & I had a room with a balcony. Excellent location, 5-10 walking minutes from Las Ramblas in addition to the metro & bus lines. The breakfast was also very pleasant, nothing fancy but it was fresh & the staff always ensured there was plenty of food. I will definetely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: NMDA
Reviews.Content: Great location. nice and central within easy 10 min walk to Pl Catalunya. Clean hotel, friendly staff. Good breakfast. We had one of their evening menus for 35 euro/pp. It included water, cocktail and bottle of wine plus good food. My only gripe was poor lighting in bathroom and poor drainage of bathroom sink.Overall strongly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Hip! Why need a replacement?”
Reviews.Author: toledoashley
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel in a great location. I prefer staying slightly away from Las Ramblas and this hotel is just about 5-10 minutes walk away. the restaurant is excellent - I know there have been some patchy reviews on this, but the general standard of food is top notch - the service is casual, which fits the feel of the hotel. Would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: HMatthews
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for our wedding anniversary this is a lovely hotel very clean very modern staff very helpful. The room was wonderful although a little small we had a very nice bath/shower room and a very comfortable bed pity there were no tea making facilitys in the room, but the really good thing was that they had a decent hairdryer in the bathroom ! and dressing gowns. The only thing that really lets it down is the price of the drinks in the bar this is a lovely bar and we would have liked to have spent more time there but the drink prices were way over the top £10 for a gin & tonic ! The tour bus is fantastic "Bus Touristic" I booked our 2 day ticket before we went via their web site we managed to see most of the city and surrounding areas by using this bus and you never had to wait more than about 5 mins for one to come along..brilliant. If you stay at the Casanova I would say it will take you about 15-20mins to walk to the port but it is well worth it especially if you walk through the Gothic quarter. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Johal-7RJ
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there for 6 nights and it was ideal for us. It is 5-10 mins walk to Placa Catalunya and 4 mins walk to the nearest metro station. Rather than getting the taxi from the airport, it is better getting an Aerobus which costs about 4 euros per passenger. The Aerobus stops 2 blocks away from the hotel. Reasonably priced on Lastminute.com, cheaper than booking direct. The rooms have laminate flooring and small rugs near the bed. Only problem is that they do not provide slippers. Highlight has to be the bathroom, which includes a tub and a wetroom, best of both worlds! The water pressure is quite strong and is always piping hot. Being a European hotel they do not provide kettle or tea facilities in the room. We only had breakfast once and would rate it as good. They do not provide hot food such as Omellete and their fruit selection is somewhat limited. The staff are very friendly although they are a bit slow in providing an iron and ironing board. The bar is quite stylish but the drinks can be lethal depending on who is serving them.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location, Good staff, Poor Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: RossCornwall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 Nights, and Location was Very Good and we where able to vist many different attractions. The staff some where more helpful than other but overall Good. The Restaurant was not very good quality foods and very experience, there seemed to a bit of lack of things to do in hotel, like internet, pool. Also the price of the massage, etc was well too much. I would recommend it if you can get an cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: RichardBrighton
Reviews.Content: After many hours of searching hotels on trip advisor and the net I finally decided on the hotel Casanova for 4 night break, we were impressed, we stayed in a Junior Suite which had a separate shower, bath and lounge area. The bed was massive with well appointed rooms in general. Some observations: the rooms to the rear of the hotel are quite dark and have no view, it’s a 10 minute walk to the top of the Rambla and 20 minutes to the central area. I would recommend this hotel however if your after a really central location I would pick Hotel 1898 or one of the hotel on the Rambla as it quite a stagger back last thing at night. Few Points on Barcelona, taxi is the easiest way to get from the Airport its around 20 euros and worth it with big suitcases, the underground system is brilliant, cheap efficient trains run every five minutes and walk along the Rambla but don’t eat there, its expensive and there are far better restaurants a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Times...”
Reviews.Author: Balliolensis
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading several positive reviews on TripAdvisor. We can confirm that the hotel is very stylish, relatively inexpensive, the staff helpful and the location ideal for seeing the sights of the city. Our standard room was street-facing and the traffic noise was not a problem in the slightest; if you are in a city you should expect a fair level of ambient noise. The bathroom was clean, modern and well-fitted; large shower head and clean bath in a wet room. The bedroom itself was not particularly spacious but was comfortable, the air-conditioning worked efficiently, the bed was large; in short, it was exactly what we wanted after a long day of sightseeing. We would highly recommend the Casanova to anyone wishing to enjoy a smooth and comfortable stay in a central area in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “good base for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: Andysin
Reviews.Content: just returned after spending 2 nights at the Casanova Barcelona. Excellent location for transoprt links and as abase for exploring the city. Room we had was at the front of the hotel overlooking the main road and was a little noisey, but perhaps that's being over critical. Comfort, decor and size of the room is above average and the bed a joy to sleep in. I stayed on a room only basis and found the cost of eating in the hotel prohibitive ( 20 euros each for a continental breakfast ?) and found god option for a cheap breakfast directly opposite the hotel. Reception staff were very cold and disinterested on check in, but on he whole a good hotel if a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grenouillesansleau
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my third stay in Barcelona, this time in connection with a "language holiday" at the Don Quijote Spanish school on Gran Via. The hotel is very conveniently located on Gran Via, about a 10 minute walk from the school and Plaza Catalunya. Barcelona has a well-deserved reputation for stylish hotels, shops and restaurants - and the Rafael Casanova lives up to the city's high standards. The hotel boasts a very funky and comfortable lobby/bar that is perfect for lounging at the end of a long day of shopping or sightseeing. The staff are friendly, particularly the regular doorman. I had asked for a quiet room because I would be studying, so I was given a room on the 3rd floor facing the courtyard. This limited exposure to noise from the street, but unfortunately the sound insulation between rooms and between the rooms and the corridor is poor. When people came back to the hotel late at night, it sounded like they were talking (loudly) right beside my bed. Overall, the noise levels didn't bother me, but if you noise bothers you be wary of booking here. The room itself was great - very comfortable and stylish. While the desk was small, the room came equipped with side tables you could pull over the bed - perfect for bedside reading or computing. I appreciated the fact that broadband internet access, if you connected to the network via a cable loaned by the front desk, was free. It cut out a few times for brief periods but overall it worked very well, as I needed it to, for work purposes (because I had to stay connected to the office even while on holiday). The best feature of the room was the bathroom. Again, the decor was great and it was of a good size. It came stocked with robes, good quality towels and toiletries from "The White Company" - the only minor disappointment is that the hotel provides only a combination shampoo/conditioner, which I dislike. The best feature of the bathroom was the bath/shower arrangement. It took up half the bathroom and was enclosed in glass. There was a large comfortable bathtub and beside it, a tiled shower area with a powerful shower equipped with a rain showerhead. I loved that shower - and regretted the fact that my husband wasn't in Barcelona to enjoy it with me. Aside from the minor irritant of the lack of sound insulation, the only other negative aspect of my experience at this hotel was the reservation process. I tried to book directly on the hotel's internet website but balked at doing so when I realized that the hotel wanted me to provide my passport number (and to do so on a page that wasn't secure - before moving to a secure page). So I called the 1-800 reservation number and was faced with the same request for a passport number. The booking agent stated that it was part of a policy, a "legal requirement", to ensure that foreign visitors didn't leave the country without paying their bills. Yeah, right. I'm willing to provide a passport number, only on check-in, when I stay in a foreign country as part of the hotel's obligation to register foreign guests with the local police. It is, however, contrary to a hotel's merchant agreements with credit card companies to require such identification as part of a credit card payment process - and I'm certainly not going to provide it as part of a hotel booking process. So I declined to do so and proceeded to book the hotel through Expedia (for a slightly better price and in US dollars, thereby avoiding the charges my bank levies for foreign currency transactions on my credit card). On balance, I'd certainly stay at the hotel again because it's such a stylish and convenient hotel, but I'm very disappointed with the hotel's reservation policy. I plan to raise the hotel's booking policy with my credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Naraloo
Reviews.Content: Very stylish hotel in a good location in Barcelona close to the University. A short walk from Playa Catalunya and Ramblas. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. There was some problem with our booking between the Uk travel agent and the Spanish travel agent, but they took care of it and understood the concept of customer service which is not always the case. Our first night, because of this booking confusion we were allocated a smoking room, which really was smoky but on the second night they upgraded us to a better class room. The breakfast was very nice and the cocktail lounge was stylish although very quiet while we were there. Don't let the hotel book you a taxi to the airport, there is an additional charge and taxis are very easy to get on the street.

HotelInfo.Name: H10 Casanova
HotelInfo.Address: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, 559, 08011 Barcelona, Spain (Formerly Rafaelhoteles by Casanova)
